blog.name: drownthesadnessinmusic
blog.title: Drowning the sadness in music
blog.description: Just... hanging out.

body:
Good Omens Christian Reaction

So my mum is hardcore Christian (not the ones who yell at guys kissing no) and I have just watched the first episode of Good Omens. I think it’s brilliant but I wanted to hear her thoughts.

So we’re working on something and I’m telling her what the show is about and what happens, and she’s laughing her head off. Good start.

Then I tell her about Adam and the hellhound. I say that adam named it Dog and she cracks up saying

“You do realize that’s a Genesis thing? Like Adam naming all the animals?”

Mind blown and shocked how did I not realize this??

And she loves how Crowley and Aziraphale are basically drinking buddies.

Mother approves stamp! Rare when it comes to shows like this.

summary: seeing all the new Good Omens fan content is cute but just remember that Crowley and Aziraphale aren’t Good and Evil. the whole...
body: seeing all the new Good Omens fan content is cute but just remember that Crowley and Aziraphale aren’t Good and Evil. the whole point is that Crowley is kinder and more empathetic than he really wants to be—he hung around with the wrong people—and Aziraphale is ‘just enough of a bastard to be worth liking’. Aziraphale adheres really strictly to Heaven’s moral code and so generally does things we would see as Good, but he also stands back and accepts things like The Great Flood due to his faith in The Ineffible Divine Plan.

reblog.comment: seeing all the new Good Omens fan content is cute but just remember that Crowley and Aziraphale aren’t Good and Evil. the whole point is that Crowley is kinder and more empathetic than he really wants to be—he hung around with the wrong people—and Aziraphale is ‘just enough of a bastard to be worth liking’. Aziraphale adheres really strictly to Heaven’s moral code and so generally does things we would see as Good, but he also stands back and accepts things like The Great Flood due to his faith in The Ineffible Divine Plan.

trail.content_raw: seeing all the new Good Omens fan content is cute but just remember that Crowley and Aziraphale aren’t Good and Evil. the whole point is that Crowley is kinder and more empathetic than he really wants to be—he hung around with the wrong people—and Aziraphale is ‘just enough of a bastard to be worth liking’. Aziraphale adheres really strictly to Heaven’s moral code and so generally does things we would see as Good, but he also stands back and accepts things like The Great Flood due to his faith in The Ineffible Divine Plan.
trail.content: seeing all the new Good Omens fan content is cute but just remember that Crowley and Aziraphale aren’t Good and Evil. the whole point is that Crowley is kinder and more empathetic than he really wants to be—he hung around with the wrong people—and Aziraphale is ‘just enough of a bastard to be worth liking’. Aziraphale adheres really strictly to Heaven’s moral code and so generally does things we would see as Good, but he also stands back and accepts things like The Great Flood due to his faith in The Ineffible Divine Plan.
